line.text: O how much more doth beauty beauteous seem
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: By that sweet ornament which truth doth give
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: The rose looks fair but fairer we it deem
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: For that sweet odour which doth in it live
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: The canker blooms have full as deep a dye
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: As the perfumed tincture of the roses
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Hang on such thorns and play as wantonly
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: When summer breath their masked buds discloses
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But for their virtue only is their show
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: They live unwooed and unrespected fade
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Die to themselves Sweet roses do not so
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Of their sweet deaths are sweetest odours made
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And so of you beauteous and lovely youth
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: When that shall vade by verse distills your truth
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
